intro: Lapsana cappadocica, commonly known as common hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with hairy stems and lobed, heart-shaped leaves. Its bright yellow flowers appear in late spring to early summer, and it produces small, spiky achenes as seeds. Lapsana cappadocica is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in meadows.
